section.title: lms.djangoapps.grades.rest_api.v1.gradebook_views module
section.paragraph: Defines an endpoint for gradebook data related to a course.

desc_content.paragraph: A base class for course info APIs. TODO: https://openedx.atlassian.net/browse/EDUCATOR-3755 This whole thing is duplicated from cms/djangoapps/contentstore
Context manager that yields a course, given a request and course_key.
Returns information about assignments and assignment types for a course. Example Requests

block_quote.paragraph: A GET request may include the following parameters.

list_item.paragraph: graded_only (boolean) - If true, only returns subsection data for graded subsections (defaults to False).

block_quote.paragraph: The HTTP 200 response has the following values.

definition_list_item.term: assignment_types - A dictionary keyed by the assignment type name with the following values:

list_item.paragraph: min_count - The minimum number of required assignments of this type.
weight - The weight assigned to this assignment type for course grading.
type - The name of the assignment type.
drop_count - The maximum number of assignments of this type that can be dropped.
short_label - The short label prefix used for short labels of assignments of this type (e.g. ‘HW’).

definition_list_item.term: subsections - A list of subsections contained in this course.

list_item.paragraph: module_id - The string version of this subsection’s location.
display_name - The display name of this subsection.
graded - Boolean indicating whether this subsection is graded (for at least one user in the course).
short_label - A short label for graded assignments (e.g. ‘HW 01’).
assignment_type - The assignment type of this subsection (for graded assignments only).

desc_content.paragraph: Whether or not to show bulk management for this course. Currently, if a course has a master’s track or is enabled with the grades.bulk_management course waffle flag.
Checks for course author access for the given course by the requesting user. Calls the view function if has access, otherwise raises a 403.

definition.paragraph: Creates PersistentSubsectionGradeOverride objects for multiple (user_id, usage_id) pairs in a given course, and invokes a Django signal to update subsection grades in an asynchronous celery task.
POST /api/grades/v1/gradebook/{course_id}/bulk-update
This endpoint does not accept any URL parameters.

An HTTP 202 may be returned if a grade override was created for each of the requested (user_id, usage_id) pairs in the request data. An HTTP 403 may be returned if the writable_gradebook feature is not enabled for this course. An HTTP 404 may be returned for the following reasons:

list_item.paragraph: The requested course_key is invalid.
No course corresponding to the requested key exists.
The requesting user is not enrolled in the requested course.

definition.paragraph: An HTTP 422 may be returned if any of the requested (user_id, usage_id) pairs did not have a grade override created due to some exception. A reason detailing the exception is provided with each response item.
“user_id”: 9, “usage_id”: “some-requested-usage-id”, “success”: true, “reason”: null

block_quote.paragraph: “user_id”: 9, “usage_id”: “a-valid-usage-key-that-doesn’t-exist”, “success”: false, “reason”: “a-valid-usage-key-that-doesn’t-exist does not exist in this course”
“user_id”: 1234-I-DO-NOT-EXIST, “usage_id”: “a-valid-usage-key”, “success”: false, “reason”: “User matching query does not exist.”

desc_content.paragraph: Checks for course author access for the given course by the requesting user. Calls the view function if has access, otherwise raises a 403.

list_item.paragraph: Get course gradebook entries of a single user in a course,

definition.paragraph: or of all users who are actively enrolled in a course. The currently logged-in user may request all enrolled user’s grades information if they are allowed.

list_item.paragraph: Get grades for specific user in course, only show {number} latest records

definition.paragraph: A GET request may include the following query parameters. * username: (optional) A string representation of a user’s username. * user_contains: (optional) A substring against which a case-insensitive substring filter will be performed

block_quote.paragraph: on the USER_MODEL.username, or the USER_MODEL.email, or the PROGRAM_ENROLLMENT.external_user_key fields.

list_item.paragraph: username_contains: (optional) A substring against which a case-insensitive substring filter will be performed on the USER_MODEL.username field.
cohort_id: (optional) The id of a cohort in this course. If present, will return grades only for course enrollees who belong to that cohort.
enrollment_mode: (optional) The slug of an enrollment mode (e.g. “verified”). If present, will return grades only for course enrollees with the given enrollment mode.

definition.paragraph: If the request for gradebook data is successful, an HTTP 200 “OK” response is returned. The HTTP 200 response for a single has the following values: * course_id: A string representation of a Course ID. * email: A string representation of a user’s email. * user_id: The user’s integer id. * username: A string representation of a user’s username passed in the request. * full_name: A string representation of the user’s full name. * passed: Boolean representing whether the course has been

block_quote.paragraph: passed according to the course’s grading policy.

list_item.paragraph: percent: A float representing the overall grade for the course
progress_page_url: A link to the user’s progress page.
section_breakdown: A list of subsection grade details, as specified below.

definition.paragraph: A response for all user’s grades in the course is paginated, and contains “count”, “next” and “previous” keys, along with the actual data contained in a “results” list.

definition_list_item.term: An HTTP 404 may be returned for the following reasons:

list_item.paragraph: The requested course_key is invalid.
No course corresponding to the requested key exists.
No user corresponding to the requested username exists.
The requested user is not enrolled in the requested course.

definition.paragraph: An HTTP 403 may be returned if the writable_gradebook feature is not enabled for this course.
“user_id”: 9, “username”: “staff”, “percent”: 0.36, “section_breakdown”: [

“are_grades_published”: true, “auto_grade”: false, “category”: null, “chapter_name”: “Introduction”, “comment”: “”, “detail”: “”, “displayed_value”: “0.00”, “grade_description”: “(0.00/0.00)”, “is_ag”: false, “is_average”: false, “is_manually_graded”: false, “label”: null, “module_id”: “block-v1:edX+DemoX+Demo_Course+type@sequential+block@edx_introduction”, “percent”: 0.0, “score_earned”: 0.0, “score_possible”: 0.0, “section_block_id”: “block-v1:edX+DemoX+Demo_Course+type@chapter+block@abcdefgh123”, “subsection_name”: “Demo Course Overview”

When requesting gradebook entries for all users, the response is paginated and contains the following values: * next: The URL containing the next page of data. * previous: The URL containing the previous page of data. * results: A list of user gradebook entries, structured as above. * total_users_count: The total number of active users in the course. * filtered_users_count: The total number of active users that match

block_quote.paragraph: the filter associated with the provided query parameters.

desc_content.paragraph: Note: It’s important that GradeViewMixin is the first inherited class here, so that self.api_error returns error responses as expected.
Checks for course author access for the given course by the requesting user. Calls the view function if has access, otherwise raises a 403.

list_item.paragraph: This api is to get information about a users original grade for a subsection.

definition.paragraph: It also exposes any overrides that now replace the original grade and a history of user changes with time stamps of all changes.
GET /api/grades/v1/subsection/{subsection_id}/?user_id={user_id}
A GET request may include the following query parameters. * user_id: (required) An integer represenation of a user

If the request for subsection grade data is successful, an HTTP 200 “OK” response is returned. The HTTP 200 response has the following values: * subsection_id: A string representation of the usage_key for a course subsection * user_id: The user’s integer id * course_id: A string representation of a Course ID. * original_grade: An object representation of a users original grade containing:

list_item.paragraph: earned_all: The float score a user earned for all graded and not graded problems
possible_all: The float highest score a user can earn for all graded and not graded problems
earned_graded: The float score a user earned for only graded probles
possible_graded: The float highest score a user can earn for only graded problems

definition_list_item.term: override: An object representation of an over ride for a user’s subsection grade containing:

list_item.paragraph: earned_all_override: The float overriden score a user earned for all graded and not graded problems
possible_all_override: The float overriden highest score a user can earn for all graded and not graded problems
earned_graded_override: The float overriden grade a user earned for only graded problems
possible_graded_override: The float overriden highest possible grade a user can earn for only graded problems

definition_list_item.term: history: A list of history objects that contain

list_item.paragraph: user: The string representation of the user who was responsible for overriding the grade
comments: A string comment about why that person changed the grade
created: The date timestamp the grade was changed
feature: The string representation of the feature through which the grade was overrriden
action: The string representation of the CRUD action the override did

definition_list_item.term: An HTTP 404 may be returned for the following reasons:

list_item.paragraph: The requested subsection_id is invalid.
The requested user_id is invalid.

NOTE: if you pass in a valid subsection_id and a valid user_id with no data representation in the DB then you will still recieve a 200 with a response with ‘original_grade’, ‘override’ and ‘course_id’ set to None and the ‘history’ list will be empty.

definition.paragraph: “subsection_id”: “block-v1:edX+DemoX+Demo_Course+type@sequential+block@basic_questions”, “user_id”: 2, “course_id”: “course-v1:edX+DemoX+Demo_Course”, “original_grade”: {
}, “override”: {
}, “history”: [
“user”: “edx”, “comments”: null, “created”: “2018-12-03T18:52:36.087134Z”, “feature”: “GRADEBOOK”, “action”: “CREATEORUPDATE”

desc_content.paragraph: Returns subection grade data, override grade data and a history of changes made to a specific users specific subsection grade.

list_item.paragraph: subsection_id – String representation of a usage_key, which is an opaque key of
grade. (a persistant subection)
user_id – An integer represenation of a user

desc_content.paragraph: Prefetches all course and subsection grades in the given course for the given list of users, also, fetch all the score relavant data, storing the result in a RequestCache and deleting grades on context exit.
Ensure the user making the API request has course author access to the given course.
This decorator parses the course_id parameter, checks course access, and passes the parsed course_key to the view as a parameter. It will raise a 403 error if the user does not have author access.

definition.paragraph: @course_author_access_required def my_view(request, course_key):

desc_content.paragraph: Given a request, parameter name, and default value, returns either a boolean value or the default.
A decorator to wrap a view function that takes course_key as a parameter.

field_body.paragraph: A 403 API error if the writable gradebook feature is not enabled for the given course. –

section.title: lms.djangoapps.grades.rest_api.v1.utils module
section.paragraph: Define some view level utility functions here that multiple view modules will share

desc_content.paragraph: Get the page size based on the defined page size parameter if defined.
Return a response given serialized page data, optional status_code (defaults to 200), and kwargs. Each key-value pair of kwargs is added to the response data.
Mixin class for Grades related views.
Ensures that the user is authenticated (e.g. not an AnonymousUser).

list_item.paragraph: Get course grades of all users who are enrolled in a course.

definition.paragraph: The currently logged-in user may request all enrolled user’s grades information if they are allowed.

GET /api/grades/v1/courses/{course_id}/ - Get grades for all users in course GET /api/grades/v1/courses/{course_id}/?username={username} - Get grades for specific user in course GET /api/grades/v1/courses/?course_id={course_id} - Get grades for all users in course GET /api/grades/v1/courses/?course_id={course_id}&username={username}- Get grades for specific user in course
A GET request may include the following parameters. * course_id: (required) A string representation of a Course ID. * username: (optional) A string representation of a user’s username.

If the request for information about the course grade is successful, an HTTP 200 “OK” response is returned. The HTTP 200 response has the following values. * username: A string representation of a user’s username passed in the request. * email: A string representation of a user’s email. * course_id: A string representation of a Course ID. * passed: Boolean representing whether the course has been

block_quote.paragraph: passed according to the course’s grading policy.

list_item.paragraph: percent: A float representing the overall grade for the course
letter_grade: A letter grade as defined in grading policy (e.g. ‘A’ ‘B’ ‘C’ for 6.002x) or None

definition.paragraph: “username”: “bob”, “email”: “bob@example.com”, “course_id”: “course-v1:edX+DemoX+Demo_Course”, “passed”: false, “percent”: 0.03, “letter_grade”: null,

desc_content.paragraph: Gets a course progress status. :param request: Django request object. :type request: Request :param course_id: URI element specifying the course location.

block_quote.paragraph: Can also be passed as a GET parameter instead.

field_body.paragraph: A JSON serialized representation of the requesting user’s current grade status.

list_item.paragraph: assignment_type: The type of the assignment, as configured by course staff. For example, course staff might make the assignment types Homework, Quiz, and Exam.
count: The number of assignments of the type.
dropped: Number of assignments of the type that are dropped.
weight: The weight, or effect, of the assignment type on the learner’s final grade.

desc_content.paragraph: Section grades breakdown gives out the overall grade for a user in a course accompanied by grades for each section of the course for the user.

block_quote.paragraph: Get a list of all grades for all sections, optionally filtered by a course ID or list of usernames.

definition_list_item.term: course_id: Filters the result to course grade status for the course corresponding to the

definition.paragraph: given course ID. The value must be URL encoded. Optional.

definition_list_item.term: username: List of comma-separated usernames. Filters the result to the course grade status

definition.paragraph: of the given users. Optional.

list_item.paragraph: page_size: Number of results to return per page. Optional.

block_quote.paragraph: If the request for information about the course grade status is successful, an HTTP 200 “OK” response is returned.
The HTTP 200 response has the following values.

list_item.paragraph: results: A list of the course grading status matching the request.
course_id: Course ID of the course in the course grading status.
user: Username of the user in the course enrollment.
passed: Boolean flag for user passing the course.
current_grade: An integer representing the current grade of the course.
section_breakdown: A summary of each course section’s grade.

definition_list_item.term: A dictionary in the section_breakdown list has the following keys:

list_item.paragraph: percent: A float percentage for the section.
label: A short string identifying the section. Preferably fixed-length. E.g. “HW 3”.
detail: A string explanation of the score. E.g. “Homework 1 - Ohms Law - 83% (5/6)”
category: A string identifying the category.

definition_list_item.term: prominent: A boolean value indicating that this section should be displayed as more prominent

definition.paragraph: than other items.

definition_list_item.term: next: The URL to the next page of results, or null if this is the

definition.paragraph: last page.

definition_list_item.term: previous: The URL to the next page of results, or null if this

definition.paragraph: is the first page.

block_quote.paragraph: If the user is not logged in, a 401 error is returned.
If the user is not global staff, a 403 error is returned.
If the specified course_id is not valid or any of the specified usernames are not valid, a 400 error is returned.

If the specified course_id does not correspond to a valid course or if all the specified usernames do not correspond to valid users, an HTTP 200 “OK” response is returned with an empty ‘results’ field.

desc_content.paragraph: Submission history corresponding to ProblemBlocks present in the course.
Check if request should be throttled. Raises an appropriate exception if the request is throttled.
Get submission history details. This submission history is related to only ProblemBlock and it doesn’t support LegacyLibraryContentBlock or ContentLibraries as of now.

block_quote.paragraph: Users with GlobalStaff status can retrieve everyone’s submission history.

list_item.paragraph: course_id: Course id to retrieve submission history.
username: Single username for which this view will retrieve the submission history details.

block_quote.paragraph: If there’s an error while getting the submission history an empty response will be returned. The submission history response has the following attributes:

definition_list_item.term: Results: A list of submission history:

list_item.paragraph: course_id: Course id
course_name: Course name
user: Username
location: problem location
name: problem’s display name
state: State of submission.
grade: Grade.
max_grade: Maximum possible grade.
data: problem’s data.

desc_content.paragraph: Get a list of problem xblock for the course. This doesn’t support LegacyLibraryContentBlock or ContentLibraries as of now
Prefetches grades for the given users in the given course within a context, storing in a RequestCache and deleting on context exit.
